NEWS BITES

Miami, Florida, Experiences September Spike in Home Sales Miami-Dade County condo sales increased 11.4% year-over-year in September and single-family home sales jumped 10.4%, according to the Miami Association of Realtors. Median prices and luxury transactions also rose during the same time period. Across-the-board increases are attributed to new tax laws and low mortgage rates, said Miami Chairman of the Board José María Serrano. World Property Journal

Chinese Developers Respond to Strong Secondary Property Market Property developers in Hong Kong and mainland China plan to release over 1,000 housing units over the next few weeks after the secondary property market—sales of lived-in homes—rose after Hong Kong’s leader Carrie Lam Cheng Yuet announced that mortgage rules would be relaxed to allow homebuyers to take out loans covering up to 90% of the property’s value. South China Morning Post

Housing Supply in Hong Kong Shrinks in the Third Quarter The total number of completed private residential units dropped 31.3% year-over-year in the third quarter this year in Hong Kong, according to the Transport and Housing Bureau. Fewer than 4,800 units were completed in the second quarter this year, which dropped to 4,100 in the third quarter. South China Morning Post

Canada’s Housing Market Slated for Recovery Within the Next Two Years Around 200,000 housing starts are expected to hit Canada’s market within the next two years, according to Canada’s Mortgage and Housing Corp. Even though that number is still below the decade-high of about 220,000 units in 2017, it demonstrates market stabilization since the decline following 2017. BNN Bloomberg
